00022 #region Usings
00023 using System;
00024 using System.Collections.Generic;
00025 using System.Linq;
00026 using System.Text;
00027 using Utilities.Cisco.Interfaces;
00028 #endregion
00029 
00030 namespace Utilities.Cisco
00031 {
00035     public class Input:IDisplay
00036     {
00037         #region Constructor
00038 
00042         public Input()
00043         {
00044             InputItems = new List<InputItem>();
00045             SoftKeys = new List<SoftKeyItem>();
00046         }
00047 
00048         #endregion
00049 
00050         #region Properties
00051 
00055         public string Title { get; set; }
00056 
00060         public string Prompt { get; set; }
00061 
00065         public string URL { get; set; }
00066 
00070         public List<InputItem> InputItems { get; set; }
00071 
00075         public List<SoftKeyItem> SoftKeys { get; set; }
00076 
00077         #endregion
00078 
00079         #region Overridden Functions
00080 
00081         public override string ToString()
00082         {
00083             try
00084             {
00085                 StringBuilder Builder = new StringBuilder();
00086                 Builder.Append("<CiscoIPPhoneInput><Title>").Append(Title).Append("</Title><Prompt>")
00087                     .Append(Prompt).Append("</Prompt><URL>").Append(URL).Append("</URL>");
00088                 foreach (InputItem Item in InputItems)
00089                 {
00090                     Builder.Append(Item.ToString());
00091                 }
00092                 foreach (SoftKeyItem Item in SoftKeys)
00093                 {
00094                     Builder.Append(Item.ToString());
00095                 }
00096                 Builder.Append("</CiscoIPPhoneInput>");
00097                 return Builder.ToString();
00098             }
00099             catch { throw; }
00100         }
00101 
00102         #endregion
00103     }
00104 }
